RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight A llowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MYSTIFIED rated close inside on the first turn then stalked three wide into the backstretch, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and dug in leaving the eighth pole to get up the final yards. DIVINING DANCER took the lead two deep into the opening turn and rated the pace, was briefly met into the backstretch, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement but was caught in the final yards. TRIPLE TITOS raced well off the pace in the four path the first turn, left the turn outside and bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path of the far turn but flattened inside the eighth pole. MAKE THE WAY CLEAR broke outward and made contact with My Miracle Man then settled close off the rail, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, angled six wide toward the head of the lane but showed little more. PLAYBOY ROY stalked in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but was carried to the seven path toward the head of the lane and showed little more. MY MIRACLE MAN was bumped then pinched back at the start then stalked from the three path the first turn, took a brief slim lead into the backstretch, gave chase then weakened approaching the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Triple Titos
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,outside 1/2,bid 3/8,3p far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Divining Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 5/16,rail far turn,caught final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE ROO ROO was forced inward and into Kaylee's Spitfire shortly after the start then continued inward and rated a short lead just off the rail, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was steadily handled through the stretch. TIME TO CHOOSE stalked from the inside on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, but ultimately, had to settle for second. ZIGGY STARDUST came in shortly after the start and rounded the first turn about the five path, stalked leaving the turn and started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path of the far turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. HARPERSGONEFISHING saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, then flattened stride in the lane. HAZEDNCONFUSED settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths, left the turn outside and showed little further. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE was bumped then pinched back shortly after the start and settled in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn two deep and flattened in the lane. TWO ROOM SCHOOL rounded the first turn in the six path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. HERE'STHEBREADMAN raced well back in the four and five paths the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. DON'T GET CAUGHTUP saved ground racing well back. KING KJARTAN saved ground and weakened after a half mile. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of Little Roo Roo for interference shortly after the start, lodged by the rider of Kaylee's Spitfire, and as a result, disqualified Ziggy Stardust to sixth place for initiating that early contact.

ENTRY.NAME: Hazednconfused
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p 1st turn,chased near 3/8,4& 5p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Ziggy Stardust
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in early,5p 1st turn,stalk 1/2,bid 3/8,3p turn,flatten lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 9700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 4, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 4, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARITABLE SPENNY rounded the first turn in the four path then stalked into the backstretch, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, was carried outward by the runner-up through the lane but got up in later yards. PENNSYLVANIA STEEL took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, drifted outward through the lane and was caught in later yards. FINAL SAY rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the four path of the far turn, finished evenly and took third in late yards. ELLIE'S LIL MAN rated close inside on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced close near the rail on the far turn but flattened late stretch. AWESOME BUZZ rounded the opening turn in the five path, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, remained in the five path of the far turn and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. MEGA MILLIONS saved ground on the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. HIGH PRINT saved ground early, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the five and six paths and showed little in the lane. GAMING JACK saved ground well back from early contention, bid mildly leaving the half mile pole then angled to the five path on the far turn. RUNNING VIOLENCE stalked off the rail on the first turn, chased leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn. OBANNON rounded the first turn in the six path, left the turn outside and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Ellie's Lil Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,bid 3/8,close rail far turn,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAVIOLI MAMA entered the opening turn in the four path, started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady handling to take over leaving the sixteenth pole and ran clear under the wire. IRISH SAMURAI stalked the early pace off the rail, bid from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and dug in to take second the final yards. TOUGH ONE saved ground off the pace on the first turn, eased out and gave chase from the half mile pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, finished well and was gaining on the top two. MAYSVILLE MISS was hustled in early contention then rated the pace into the first turn, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, was met mid-stretch and flattened later yards. PRETTY SPECTACULAR broke awkwardly and rounded the first turn in the five path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened stride. I B NASTY saved ground racing well back, rounded the far turn in the five path and could only improve her position. BRANDYURAFINEGIRL stalked the early pace off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn. DIVA GAL broke awkwardly and was never a factor. SHESAHUMBLEHUSTLER raced well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Tough One
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out 1/2,chased,4p far turn,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Samurai
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Ravioli Mama
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,bid 7/16,off rail far turn,up past 1/16,clear wire

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Spectacular
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,5p 1st turn,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 123 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACASHA'S INTUITION raced with the pace through the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, took the lead approaching the five sixteenths and was steadily handled to widen. MY PHOENIX gave his rivals several lengths advantage when he dwelt in the gate, raced at the rail on the first turn then endured a long steady bid from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path, came between horses near mid-stretch and got up for second the final yards. NICE BUT NAUGHTY rated close inside, bid nearing the five sixteenths pole and raced at the rail most of the far turn, eased out leaving the turn but flattened inside the eighth pole. DON'TCALLTOOEARLY saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, but showed little in the lane. BOBBYS CASE LOAD rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and had little left. IRISH FLIGHT rounded the first turn about the six path, left the turn outside and showed little response. RIVER ROYALE R V F rated a short lead inside, was pressured leaving the three eighths pole, gave up the lead toward the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn. IT'S ONLY MONEY settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Nice But Naughty
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 5/16,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: My Phoenix
ENTRY.COMMENT: dwelt break,rail 1st turn,long steady bid from 7/16,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Bobbys Case Load
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,chased 1/2,off rail far turn,little left lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOLLER pressured the pace and contested the turn at a close disadvantage two deep, dug in determinedly through the stretch and took the nod in the final strides. BAYTOWN JAKESTER was hustled along to set a pressured pace, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but gave up the nod in the final strides. ADIOS SEE YA chased the pace through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn, eased slightly out leaving the turn, angled in toward mid-stretch but brushed the rail and was steadied in late yards. LION OF THE SEA chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and finished well. JAIME JAMEL chased toward the inside, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened in late stretch. DINNER BELL chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened the final furlong. WORLD OF FOOLS angled out to give chase, rounded the turn about the eight path and passed rivals widest. URBAN WARRIOR gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the six path and showed little in the lane. SCAREDY CAT was not a factor. FOREVER THE BOSS engaged in close early chase but weakened in the three path of the turn and was eased in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Adios See Ya
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,brushed rail late yards,steadied

ENTRY.NAME: Baytown Jakester
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,dug in lane,yield nod final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RED DEVOLUTION took over while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, widened leaving the first turn, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. PLUNK raced off the pace about the three path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, was gaining in later yards but had to settle for second. CRYPTIC CODE rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced in the six path of the far turn and came along to take third the final strides. SPARKLING SHIRE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail but flattened in the lane. SMOOZER raced off the pace in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then weakened. CHERRYS CROSS showed little response through the backstretch. SHEA D CAPTURE rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase from the three eighths pole but flattened in the three path of the far turn. SLOE GIN BIZ steadied off the heels of Smoozer midway on the opening turn, angled out from that point but showed little further. KLIMT RIDE faded after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Plunk
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,gaining,settled 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Red Devolution
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,widened from 1/2,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 4, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Enter ed For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RULING took the lead leaving the chute and rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. BULL SHARK chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, drifted through the stretch and finished evenly outside. AWESUMMER chased, rounded the turn near the rail and cleared third past the eighth pole. WIZARD OF ODDS gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. ATTUCK chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, eased out into the stretch and finished evenly. LUCKYTOBEINAMERICA was not a factor. U ROCK IT steadied at the break, gave chase through the backstretch then flattened in the four path of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Bull Shark
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,drifted stretch,even finish outside

ENTRY.NAME: Ruling
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail turn,steady handling lane

ENTRY.NAME: Attuck
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and TEC Racing (Elliott S Logan)

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TREAT ME SPECIAL was bumped leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and raced close in the four path of the turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew clear inside the sixteenth pole. NANNY'S MISSION was bumped inward and into Treat Me Special leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the three path, was eased to the seven path toward the head of the lane and dug in to take second later yards. SUDDEN FLARE came away a step slow, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn near the rail, eased outward looking for room through the stretch and got up for third the final yards. PRINCESS MIA ROSE chased, raced at the rail on the turn, angled to the three path into the lane and finished well. NOBLE PRESENT was hustled to the front approaching the five sixteenths pole and contested the edge at the rail on the turn, but was met mid-stretch and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. BLUE BONNIE ducked out leaving the gate but took an early lead and set a pressured pace, was caught and gave chase toward the five sixteenths pole, raced close two deep on the turn then flattened stride the final sixteenth. LICENSE TO CARRY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four and five paths but showed little in the lane. GREAT DEVOTION gave chase, rounded the turn in the seven path and raced outside leaving the turn. RED LIL SHIPMENT veered inward and into Nanny's Mission leaving the gate then pressured the early pace, raced close at the rail through the turn then weakened the final sixteenth. OUR GOLDEN COLLEEN gave chase then flattened in the three path of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Noble Present
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to front near 5/16,edge rail turn,met 1/16,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Sudden Flare
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,chased,rail turn,eased out lane,up 3rd late

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Hal Snowden Jr. & Morris B. Floyd
